A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Horrible. Disappointing. And worst\, boring. If Mel Brooks had more money and interest in CGI\, ‘Spaceballs’ might have looked like this. But ‘Spaceballs’ was intended to be a comedy. This movie was trying too hard to be a Marvel movie. Crammed full of lousy dad jokes. Pointless side trips that accomplished nothing but wasting hours of my time. A lot of action occurred on screen\, but there was almost zero chemistry between the people. And there was no character development\, so you just didn’t care what happened to them anyways. The villain they’ve been talking up was Gollum after his swim in Mt. Doom and shockingly weak. Wonder how many film critics will be taking free trips to Disney World this summer? That’s the only way I can explain their overwhelmingly positive response to this snoozefest. It was overprocessed\, commercialized crap.
